channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Accessing the Blue Badge Parking Space, 21st September
item.description:
How can private vehicles access the blue badge parking space without getting a penalty from the 'taxi/motor bike entry only' restriction?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elm Grove, Peckham, London

item.title: Dug up pavement and fallen barriers, 21st September
item.description:
Payment has been dug up for some time. Pile of paving slabs. Whole thing appears to have been abandoned. It is causing an obstruction to the pavement and needs attention.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Den Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large household items being fly-tipped, garges near Martock Court & Yarnfield Square., 21st September
item.description:
There has been a recent increase of large household items being fly-tipped at the garages in between Martock Court & Yarnfield Square. Items such as refrigerators, beds, other items of furniture, black bags full of clothes etc. are being dumped at this spot on a regular basis. This is more than a car's worth of rubbish, this feels like a van has cleared somewhere out and dumps this rubbish here frequently.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Consort Road, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light out at night for the past few weeks., 21st September
item.description:
The street light is not on for the past few weeks, already reported a month ago, but no action taken. Its very dark at sunset.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 61, Hurst Road, Albany Park, Sidcup, London

item.title: Graffiti in Chilham Way, 21st September
item.description:
There is graffiti on the brick wall behind the Chilham Way shopping parade 'square' (on the same side as the Budgens convenience store). This graffiti needs to be removed ASAP, otherwise it will multiply.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pembury Close, Hayes, London

item.description:

item.title: Street tree felled in Chatham Avenue, 21st September
item.description:
A tree has been felled in the section of Chatham Avenue that is close to the junction with Mounthurst Road - only the stump remains in situ. Please would you remove the stump and plant a new suitable species of street tree when the tree planting season begins in November 2025.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, Chilham Way, Hayes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street weeds growing in Chatham Avenue, 21st September
item.description:
There are weeds growing on the pavement and in the kerbs in the section of Chatham Avenue near the junction with Mounthurst Road. These weeds need to be sprayed with weed killer and the 'die-back' removed as soon as possible.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, Chilham Way, Hayes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tarmac surface near bus stop in Mounthurst Road needs resurfacing, 21st September
item.description:
The tarmac surface close to the kerb near the 314 Bougton Avenue stop in Mounthurst Road is broken and needs resurfacing. Please would you inspect and then carry out the necessary remedial work.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mounthurst Road, Hayes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TESCO pathway between Tesco patrol station and Tesco overflow car park is full of rubbish. Spoke to car park cleaner, he said "there is no time to clean the pathway as too much to do in the carpark and petrol station area, no time for the overflow pathway", 21st September
item.description:
Looks like this pathway between the Tesco petrol station and the overflow carpark is completely ignored cleaning wise. Never being cleaned. I guess this must be Tesco`s responsibility. Spoke to Tesco cleaner who is cleaning the car park every morning: he said, he has "no time" as he is only paid for 2 hrs and too much to do during that 2 hours in the main car park. The compound protected overflow car park is a rubbish dumping place too. Tesco doesn`t seem to care. The all area is an eye-sore. I request the authorities to inspect it and enforce Tesco to clean up the place.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mandela Way, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Nelson Mandela Road - flytipping and litter, 21st September
item.description:
Items of wood and fly tipping dumped along the road. Needs a deep clean. Litter is everywhere and the council are neglecting this area. Email sent to MP due to lack of action from RBG

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nelson Mandela Road, Kidbrooke, London
Report on FixMyStreet
